title: Video diaries show fear and desperation in Gaza
description: Palestinians in the Gaza Strip described hospitals overwhelmed with patients and people attempting to find shelter as well as widespread confusion after being ordered by Israel to evacuate south with nowhere to go.

title: U.S. officials privately warn Israel to show restraint in retaliating against Hamas
description: As Israel girds for a fearsome ground assault into Gaza, senior Biden administration officials are warning their Israeli counterparts to show restraint.

title: Trump falsely characterized Israel's role in his administration's hit on Iran's Soleimani, say former U.S. officials
description: Trump falsely characterized Israel’s role in his administration’s assassination of a top Iranian general, say U.S. officials familiar with the planning.

title: 18 beauty and wellness holiday gifts for everyone on your list
description: From skin care to clothing, shop the best self-care gifts for anyone this holiday season. Discover top picks from Hatch, Skims, Alo and more.

title: Faced with more lawsuits, Ohio State denies covering up sex abuse scandal years after paying out millions in damages
description: Ohio State University has paid out $60 million in settlement money in the last few years to hundreds of former students and athletes who say they were sexually abused decades ago by a school doctor.

title: Can Israel take out the tunnels that Hamas uses to move its fighters and weapons?
description: In its offensive against Hamas, Israel’s military is dropping U.S.-made munitions on the maze of tunnels used by Hamas to move weapons and shield its forces.

title: 27 Advent calendars you’ll love this season
description: The best Advent calendars for adults and kids are filled with chocolate, wine, beauty products and more. Shop Advent calendars  from Bonne Maman, Sephora and Lego.

title: 'Top secret' Hamas documents show that terrorists intentionally targeted elementary schools and a youth center
description: Documents exclusively obtained by NBC News show that Hamas created detailed plans to target elementary schools and a youth center in the Israeli kibbutz of Kfar Sa'ad, to "kill as many people as possible."

title: 'Everybody is scared': As Gaza faces threat of ground invasion, tensions run high in Israel
description: As residents of northern Gaza scrambled for safety amid bombs and the threat of a possible ground invasion, across Israel, the start of a Jewish Shabbat was marked by high tensions, sirens and rockets.

title: The 28 best gifts under $25
description: Shop the best holiday gifts under $25. Finding presents for your loved ones shouldn’t have to break the bank, we found budget finds that your giftee will love.

title: The 7 best sales to shop this week
description: These are the best post-Prime Day sales from Ulta, Casper, Buffy and more

title: Flu and RSV are starting to rise in the U.S., as Covid peaks in some areas
description: There are signs that flu is beginning to spread across the U.S., the CDC warned Friday. Some fear a “tripledemic” of Covid, flu and RSV could occur this winter.

title: Human rights watchdog says Israel has used white phosphorus weapons in Gaza
description: A human rights watchdog group said Thursday that Israel’s military has used white phosphorus munitions in recent days in Gaza and Lebanon,.

title: Under threats of a ground invasion, Gaza residents desperately seek safety but options are dire
description: The Israeli Defense Forces ordered people to evacuate from northern Gaza, a plan the U.N. said would entail moving more than 1 million and was “impossible.”

title: Watch: NBC News crew takes cover during rocket fire near Israel border
description: During a live report, NBC News' Ellison Barber and her crew were forced to take cover after rocket fire went off near the Israel-Gaza border. Israel is expected to be launching a ground offensive on Gaza.

title: Migrant workers from Asia are caught in the crosshairs of the Israel-Hamas war
description: Migrant workers from Thailand, Nepal, the Philippines and elsewhere are among those killed and wounded in the Israel-Hamas war.

title: As Republicans face turmoil, Jim Jordan re-enters speaker race after Scalise drops out
description: Judiciary Chairman Jim Jordan said on Friday that he is re-entering the race for House speaker, just a day after Steve Scalise dropped his bid/

title: How long has the House been without a speaker?
description: NBC News is tracking the hours, minutes and seconds since Kevin McCarthy was ousted from the position.

title: Dashcam footage shows Hamas terrorists beating Arab man at kibbutz
description: Dashcam footage shows Osama Abu Asa, 36, beaten by Hamas terrorists. A Bedouin living in Israel’s Negev desert, Abu Asa would later be found dead, according to his brother.

title: Friendship bracelets, novelty popcorn buckets and lots of singing: Taylor Swift 'Eras Tour' goes to the big screen
description: The debut of Taylor Swift’s ‘Eras Tour’ concert film is sending fans to theaters en masse for more than two hours of singing and dancing to the Grammy-winning artist.

title: Biden delivers remarks on his Bidenomics agenda in Philadelphia
description: Watch live coverage as President Biden travels to Philadelphia and delivers remarks on his administration's Bidenomics agenda.

title: WATCH: Residents of Gaza City pack into vehicles and head south after Israel's warning
description: Residents of Gaza City packed their belongings and squeezed into their vehicles to head south on Friday, after Israel's military called for all civilians to "Evacuate your homes immediately!”

title: Biden set to speak with families of Americans believed to be held hostage in Gaza
description: Israel estimates that 150 people are being held prisoner. The number of U.S. hostages is believed to be less than a handful, National Security Council spokesperson John Kirby said.

title: 1 police officer killed, another wounded in shooting at Philadelphia airport garage
description: A police officer was fatally shot and another was wounded after confronting people breaking into a car at Philadelphia International Airport Thursday night, officials said.

title: How the conspiracy-fueled Epoch Times went mainstream and made millions
description: The Epoch Times is one of the U.S.’s most successful and influential conservative news organizations. It’s powered by Falun Gong, a religious group persecuted in China.

title: Jada Pinkett Smith reveals what Chris Rock said to her off stage after Will Smith slap
description: Jada Pinkett Smith is revealing what happened off camera immediately after Will Smith slapped Chris Rock on stage at the 2022 Academy Awards.

title: Kaiser Permanente and labor unions reach tentative deal after strike
description: Kaiser Permanente and labor unions reached a tentative deal Friday morning, a little more than a week after workers at the nation’s largest health care nonprofit organization went on strike.

title: Gazans ordered to flee and how to see the 'ring of fire' solar eclipse: Morning Rundown
description: Get everything you need to know to start your day. Sign up to get the Morning Rundown newsletter to your email inbox.

title: Israelis wrestle with whether to punish or rally behind Netanyahu government
description: Long before Hamas terrorists infiltrated Israel on Saturday in an unprecedented breach, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s grip on power was in peril.

title: Fran Drescher fires back at the studio heads after negotiations breakdown
description: Actors union head Fran Drescher says she was "shocked" after studio heads abruptly walked out of negotiations this week after five days of talks between them fell apart.

title: Israel issues warning for civilians in Northern Gaza: Evacuate now
description: Israel issued a warning to one million Palestinians to evacuate Northern Gaza within 24 hours, signalizing that ground invasion is imminent. NBC’s Richard Engel reports for TODAY.

title: Births in China slide 10% to hit their lowest on record
description: The number of births in China tumbled 10% last year to hit their lowest level on record, amid worries that the country has become demographically imbalanced.

title: Antony Blinken meets with Palestinian leader Mahmoud Abbas in Amman
description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken met Friday with Palestinian Authority President Mahmoud Abbas in Amman to discuss the fallout from Hamas’ terrorist attack on Israel, especially repercussions in the occupied West Bank.

title: China appears to have forcibly repatriated a ‘large number’ of North Koreans, South says
description: South Korea said on Friday it had protested to China over the suspected forced repatriation of a large number of North Koreans.

title: Japan seeks to dissolve Unification Church tied to Shinzo Abe killing
description: The Japanese government is seeking to dissolve the Unification Church, which came under scrutiny after the 2022 killing of former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe.

title: Rare 'ring of fire' solar eclipse will cross the U.S. on Saturday: Here's how to see it
description: A spectacular solar eclipse will be visible across the entire continental U.S. this weekend, offering people from coast to coast the chance to see the moon take a “bite” out of the sun and affording lucky sky-watchers in nine states the opportunity to witness a rare “ring of fire” in the sky.

title: Israel orders 1 million Gaza residents to evacuate south
description: Israel orders 1 million Gaza residents to evacuate south

title: Families remember the Americans killed in the Israel-Hamas war
description: Nearly a week after Hamas terrorists attacked Israel, setting off a war as Israel retaliated with airstrikes over the Gaza Strip, the death toll continues to rise above 1,000.

title: What’s behind Trump’s lashing out at Netanyahu after Hamas’ attack on Israel
description: Donald Trump is lashing out with pointed criticism of Netanyahu and his government.

title: Nightly News Full Broadcast (October 12th)
description: Lester Holt is on the ground in Israel as we continue our coverage of the Israel-Hamas war. We’ll have more details on Secretary of State Blinken’s meeting with Israel Prime Minister Netanyahu and new details about Hamas’ attack on the Supernova Music Festival.

title: Rudolph Isley, who started Isley Brothers and got the nation singing  'Shout' and 'It's Your Thing,' dies at 84
description: Rudolph Isley, a founding member of the Isley Brothers who helped perform such raw rhythm and blues classics as “Shout” and “Twist and Shout” and the funky hits “That Lady” and “It’s Your Thing,” has died at age 84.

title: Agonizing choices loom for Israel as it faces a 'brutal' hostage situation
description: Facing painful choices, Israel will likely have to place a higher priority on striking a military blow against Hamas than rescuing all the hostages held in Gaza.

title: Single mother 'thicker than a bowl of oatmeal' wins Alaska's Fat Bear Week
description: A dominant mother bear in Alaska's Katmai National Park and Preserve has been crowned Fat Bear Week's queen of corpulence.

title: Steve Scalise withdraws from speaker's race, sending House into further turmoil
description: The decision by Scalise, a Louisiana Republican, comes just a day after he secured the GOP's nomination for the top position in the House.

title: Officer indicted by 2nd grand jury for involuntary manslaughter in Virginia mall shooting
description: A special grand jury in Virginia indicted a former police officer on Thursday for involuntary manslaughter in the fatal shooting of an unarmed shoplifting suspect outside a suburban shopping mall.
